definition: not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
Manchu ethnic group
to fill/full/filled/packed/fully/completely/quite/to reach the limit/to satisfy/satisfied/contented
(negative prefix)/not/no
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
(classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)

sentences.english: He thinks nothing of throwing away a thousand dollars at the gambling house.
sentences.chinese: 他在賭場裏一擲千金滿不在乎。

sentences.english: Your two of a kind, neither of you care about detail nor domestics.
sentences.chinese: 你們是兩個同類，都對家事和細節滿不在乎。

sentences.english: He strode out toward the friar, who gave him one glance and then went on eating unconcernedly .
sentences.chinese: 他走向僧侶，他看了一下，又滿不在乎繼續喫着。

sentences.english: Nonchalant she said that tomorrow I will give you the best gift.
sentences.chinese: 她卻滿不在乎的說，我明天會給你一個最好的禮物。

sentences.english: Events have imbued the Japanese corporate warrior with a new insouciance.
sentences.chinese: 當初日本公司的鬥士已經變得滿不在乎。

sentences.english: He did not scruple to use it.
sentences.chinese: 他滿不在乎地打算用這筆錢。

sentences.english: However, do not deem that they are not interested in status.
sentences.chinese: 但是不要以爲他們對身份地位就滿不在乎。

sentences.english: He was niggled by her careless attitude.
sentences.chinese: 她滿不在乎的態度把他給激怒了。

sentences.english: People feel uncared for and no one gives a damn.
sentences.chinese: 民衆有被漠視之感，不作爲者卻滿不在乎。

sentences.english: He had whistled in a masterful, careless way, and they had come to him.
sentences.chinese: 那時他只需神氣活現滿不在乎地吹吹口哨她們就來了。

definition: reluctant to part
to tease/to poke fun at
arrogant and obstinate (idiom)/unyielding
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
elated/light and airy feeling (after a few drinks)/smug and conceited/complacent
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to deride/to mock
resentful/humiliated and angry
red in the face/extremely angry
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
